data.title: Westfield Washington School District
data.meta_description: Program Schedule - Westfield Washington School District
data.text:
During our first session, we will take some time to get acquainted with the program, district leadership and with each other. We'll get a high-level view of the district, our goals, our latest initiatives and we'll set the stage for the remainder of your Academy experience. You'll get to know some of our leadership and we'll spend some time learning about you and what you would like to get from this exclusive experience!

Location: Central Office

19500 Tomlinson Rd.

Suite B

Westfield, IN. 46074

Date: Thursday, August 15

Speakers:

Director of Communications Joshua Andrews

Superintendent Dr. Paul Kaiser

In September, you will also receive a presentation on the business of school, how our district is funded and how we spend money to create an excellent educational environment.

Location: Shamrock Springs Elementary School

747 W 161st St

Westfield, IN 46074

Date: Thursday, September 12

Speakers:

Superintendent Dr. Paul Kaiser

Assistant Superintendent for Business Brian Tomamichel

The safety of our students and staff is our number one priority. During this session, you will hear from our head of safety and the Westfield Police Department about some of the safety measures at play every day throughout our district. You will also hear from the Director of Student Support Programs about how we are providing a nurturing and academic environment at an early age.

Location: Central Office

19500 Tomlinson Rd.

Suite A

Westfield, IN. 46074

Date: Thursday, October 10

Speakers:

Assistant Superintendent for Safety and Human Resources Chris Baldwin

Officer Tyler Dougherty

Director of Student Support Programs Marci Derado

This month, our participants will learn about learning! They will hear from our district leaders on the science behind learning, teaching pedagogy and how our teachers are continuous learners. After listening to our speakers, weâ€™ll form breakout groups that can visit classrooms to see teaching and learning in action.

Location: Westfield Intermediate School

17710 Shamrock Blvd

Westfield, IN 46074

Date: Thursday, November 14

Speakers:

Assistant Superintendent for Curriculum and Instruction Dr. John Atha

Director of Curriculum and Instruction Dr. Ryan Hoover

English Learning Coordinator Krystal Thompson

The WWS vision is to be an exemplary learning organization focused on collaboration, innovation and continuous growth for all. And, for us, all means ALL. During this session, participants will learn about the different programs and resources available to our students to aid them on their academic journey. They will hear from district leaders in special education, mental health, the AVID program, AP classes and our school nurse program.

You will also get a tour of the middle school culinary facilities and hear from our foodservice provider about how much care goes into providing our students delicious and fulfilling meals.

Location: Westfield Middle School

345 W Hoover St

Westfield, IN 46074

Date: Thursday, December 12

Speakers:

Director of Special Education and Student Services Chase Stinson

Exploring Careers and College Teacher Johnny Payne

Instructional Coach Heather Kirkley

Our first responsibility, each day, is to get students from home and to school. A lot goes into that operation and we want you to see behind the curtain of transportation. Take a ride in a district school bus as the director of transportation discusses what goes into plotting and planning routes that service the entire district. You will also learn about two of the biggest resources to our school and local community, the Westfield Education Foundation and Parent University

Location: Maple Glen Elementary School

17171 Ditch Rd

Westfield, IN 46074

Date: Thursday, January 9

Speakers:

Director of Transportation Larry Johnson

Director of Community Engagement Ashley Knott

In addition to nationally recognized academics, Westfield Washington Schools offers outstanding sports, clubs and performance art organizations to help form well-rounded students. During this session, our participants will hear from leaders in our extracurricular activities to see how we take academic and personal development beyond the classroom.

Location: Westfield High School

18250 N Union St

Westfield, IN 46074

Date: Thursday, February 13

Speakers:

High School Athletic Director Andy Tebbe

Middle School Athletic Director Doug Luce

High School Assistant Principal Kurt Frederick

Director of Student Activities Sarah Gibbs

High School Band Director Andrew Muth

At Westfield Washington Schools, we always say it is our people who make us great. So, during this session, you'll get a look at exactly how we hire, retain and develop the best teachers around! Experience the interview process, learn about how we attract new staff and get a glimpse into our New Educator Orientation.

Location: Westfield Intermediate School

17710 Shamrock Blvd

Westfield, IN 46074

Date: Thursday, April 10

Speakers:

Assistant Superintendent for Safety and Human Resources Chris Baldwin

WWS prides itself on preparing students for the real world. With the changing economic and business environment, the real world is looking different everyday. In this session, participants will learn our teachers are preparing our students to be successful the moment they walk across the graduation stage. With our Idea Farm, Rock Shop, culinary program, construction program and other amazing opportunities, our students can get real-world experience before they even leave our schools. This can give them a leg up on others as they vie for the competitive job and college market.

Location: Westfield High School

18250 N Union St

Westfield, IN 46074

Date: Thursday, May 15

Speakers:

Entrepreneur Teacher John Moore

Mass Media Teacher John Oestreich

Family and Consumer Sciences Teacher Nikki Heflin

Construction Teacher Jason Hemmerling
